ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
ygData.msgSnippet: Amassing 2500p excess is no incognizant task time wise.  Then; finding a Jeweler who can craft the gear, and getting all those items you refer to take a
ygData.messageBody:
Amassing 2500p excess is no incognizant task time wise. Then; finding a
Jeweler who can craft the gear, and getting all those items you refer to
take a significant amount of time.

Getting to 60 takes a significant amount of time. My guild has about 110
people (probably quite a few of those have quit the game not sure exactly)
Exactly three of those people are level 60.

Again - you are arguing about game balance only from your perspective.
Maybe you are strictly speaking of specific types of raids (Waking the
sleeper?) - but I'm talking about Planes, Siren's Grotto; Western Wastes,
Dragon Necropolis - and hopefully ToV soon. My guild does those regularly
and we wish we had more than one bard (me) above 50...

The bardic resist is VITAL to these raids for guilds like mine own.

Slyde

-----Original Message-----
From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
[mailto:garramone@...]
Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 11:42 AM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....


You can't dispel equipment. Are jacinth (200pp each), diamonds (500pp
each), blue diamonds (2500pp each and going down), and regular resist
gear (dragon tooth choker, froglok crown, tranix crown, countless
others) etc. out of the reach of people who have reached level 60 (or
close) and go on the type of big raids we are talking about?

When you lag or die, that means it is ok for the rest of your group to
die because they were relying on you for resists? I'm not saying bard
resists aren't nice, I'm not saying they can not be used, I am saying
there are better ways. Just as there are much better ways to battle
dispelling mobs. Uber guilds do things these ways not because it is
"their" way, but because it is the most efficient and most successful
way.

Shada/Erisi

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 9:21 AM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....


Some people are equipped better than others. "Uber" guilds get the
reputation they do is an assumption that everyone should play the way
they
do and the design of the game should be catered to the way they play.

I would argue that good equipment is as much a determinant of time spent
playing as it is ability of the player. Some of the best players I've
seen
have some of the most mediocre equipment.

So for many of us; particularly when fighting mobs that dispell - the
bards
resist songs are the difference between success and failure.

Slyde
